lines.text: Hey, Ernest, how did it go?
It worked great. Victory is at hand. Now we have to move onto what I like to call "Plan B."

Ahh, smell those Christmas trees. You can keep your 'Channel' Number 5, just give me a whiff of the old lonesome pine. That symbol of brotherly love, that centerpiece that all mankind gathers around to share the cranberry sauce shaped like a can.
Hey, wait! I think you forgot something.

Oh, no, mister, it's not me, it's my brother. He does this to me ALL the time. He takes me out, and he says he's got the money, and then we eat, and he says he's gotta go to the bathroom and he sneaks out just before the check comes in! And I'm left there with no money and this stupid look on my face, but I swear it won't happen again, so just let me go this one time, mister, OK?
Do you honestly expect me to believe that?
I swear, it's true! Oh, hey, look, it's my brother! See? There he is! Hey, Tommy!
[runs away when the manager turns to look]
I am one with the Yuletide, know what I mean?
What we have here is a failure to accumulate.

[quietly]
Santa Claus.
What did you say?
His name is Santa Claus!
[children giggle]
That's it. Yuck it up. He happens to be a close, personal friend of mine. Nyah-nyah-nyah-nyah-nyah. Fifth graders think they know everything.

[gesturing to Santa's sack]
You better check it out.
Why?
Call it... Uh, a fifth sense. Call it a flash of intermission, but I just got this feeling deep down in the heart of my bottom.
You know, I don't tell many people this, but Christmas is just about my favorite time. Ever since I was a little kid, I always felt like it was my own personal holiday.
a guy who flies around the whole world in one night. It just doesn't quite correspond to the laws of time and travel.

Now, now, now, now, now, it's possible. You take the International Date Line, multiply it by the Time Zones, divided by the accelerated rotation of the earth... uh, carry the 1, and, uh, allowing for the Vernal Equinox on the Tropic of Cancer, he might just pull it off.
The Claus.
This is Ernest. I'm Santa Claus.
[odd silence]
Surprised?
Uh, no. No, not - not really.
Ernest, I'm not really a morning person, so could you keep it down to a dull... roar?

[advances toward's Ernest's truck to see what is under the tarp in back]
I'd better have a look.

[disguised as a snake rancher, referring to the venomous "snakes" under the tarp]
Careful, now... them be "pisin"!
[lunges at the guard, who gasps and winces]
"Pisin" snakes! One minute, you be a strappin' young man like yerself, an' the next...
[imitates a snake's fangs with his fingers]
SNAP!
[swipes his "fangs" at the guard, who again gasps and winces]
Yer dead meat!

[disguised as a snake rancher, referring to the venomous snakes in the back of his truck]
Ya want one fer yer boy? I gave one to my boy last year...
[removes his hat]

[singing]
Rock of ages... a-cleft fer me... let me hide myself in thee... That's all these movie people want..."pisin"!
You're a sick man, Ernest.

The 24th... That's Christmas Eve! Who in ther right minds would be working on Christmas Eve? I'll tell ya who? WE WHO, that's who? Christmas, Thanksgiving, the Super Bowl - Bobby, if it weren't for us, this airline would NEVER get off the ground!

[a heavy crate tips over, pinning Bobby beneath it]
Ugh!
I guess if you want something done right, you got to do it yourself...
[tips the crate to look down at Bobby]
Yo, Bob? Break's over!

[Chuck drops the crate and it crushes Bobby again]
Oooof!
Joe... search your heart. There must be something there to convince you of the truth.
In a way, I wish there was... but I haven't seen anything yet.

[they have just discovered the particulars of Chuck's animal control problem]
Oh... FLYING... reindeer. Um, that's not us. You want air traffic control.
Uh yeah, air traffic control.
[they flee]

[after Ernest has just finished driving suicidally on the freeway and busted a window to rescue one]
I take it you really needed a tree?
Nah, I've already got one at home, but I've got a friend that I think could use one, besides it'd be a shame if the little guy didn't have a home for the holiday.
It's rare to meet someone with such Christmas spirit.

[to a boy telling his sister Santa isn't real]
Where do you get off? Don't say that to her! There is too a Santa, and this is his magic sack!
If that's Santa's sack, why do you have it?

[returning Santa's stolen toy sack, crying]
I'm sorry.
Welcome back, Pamela.
[hugs her]
I never doubted you would do the right thing.
Really?
Well... maybe just a little doubt.

[laughs]
I just started thinking... about you, and Ernest... and just a whole lot of things... and I really got things figured out. I even called my mom.
She must have been worried about you.
Yeah... especially after I told her who I was with.
[Santa laughs]

[disguised as "Mindy, the governor's neice"; feigning disgust]
Is this the way government REALLY works?

[it starts to snow, in spite of the tropical climate]
What's going on?
CHRISTMAS is going on!

[after Ernest gets fired]
Ernest, it was a dead end job anyway, it's nowhere working for a guy like that.
If there hadn't been children present, it might have been a very ugly scene indeed.
Why didn't you just tell him you were robbed? This all could have been avoided if you'd just lied!

[tosses Ernest's tree out of the door after him, knocking him down]
Merry Christmas!
[laughs sadistically as Ernest lies face down on the pavement]
Ernest, you are in serious need of help.
Trust people. It pays off more often that you think.

[Vern opens the door]
Ho ho ho, Vern! Merry
[Vern slams the door on him]
I thought you said this guy was your friend.
Oh Vern's just like that, he'll do anything for a laugh. Come on!
Hey! Listen, I gotta get these reindeer down to the children's museumm, like, five minutes ago, you know what I mean?
Elms?
No. Ernest.
Your name ain't Elms?
No. Ernest.
We're holding these reindeer for a guy named "Helper Elms". Now, we've got some REAL good questions, and he'd better have some REAL good answers.
Look, it's a long story, but before I tell you, let me ask you something. Do you believe in Santa Claus?

[eyes the flying reindeer on the ceiling]
Somehow... I knew this question was going to come up.

[first lines; singing as he drives a taxi]
Oh, Christmas tree, oh Christmas tree, oh Christmas tree, oh Chriiistmas tree.
[repeats over and over... and over]
Hey, could you hurry it up? I've got a flight to catch!

[disguised as Marty Brock's mother]
Don't try to defend him, honey, there's no future in it.

[after getting out of the taxi]
That'll be $32.50.
Here you go.

[notices the money]
Hey, uh, this ain't real.
What?
This money carries the likeness of one...
[with funny faces]
"Mr. Funtime".

Well I don't understand. I don't have much use for currency but I do like to keep some on hand, I just... oh my... last year, a 5 year old boy asked for a Mr. Funtime grocery store, I included a rather large amount of... play money. I suppose I must've gotten the two confused.
Dum de dum dum.
The name is Santa Claus!

[jumping into Ernest's cab and making him speed away from the restaurant where she skipped out on the bill]
You see that guy back there? That's my mean uncle, he makes me work in his restaurant like a slave, he keeps me in the basement where there's rats and filth,and I finally just escaped, so please don't let him get me!

[John Wayne voice]
Well no need to fret, young lady, you're safe with us.
...Thanks. By the way, my name's Harmony Star, remember that name, I'm going to be famous someday.
Oh this is Ernest, I'm Santa Claus.
Surprised?
Uh, no, no not, not really.
Vern throws the greatest Christmas parties, of course we're a little early so we can help him decorate and set up the food. Maybe he'll have finger sandwiches and cheese balls and bean dip!

Well I hope he's got something I can eat and not just a lot of white sugar and red meat. You know I think red meat makes people overly aggressive and makes them like, kill people and stuff, knowhutImean?
You're right as rain, pudding, pork's my meat.
You know, I don't want to insult you being we've just met and all, but you kind of remind me of somebody.
Santa Claus?
I guess you get that a lot, huh?
Well it's to be expected.
Because you look like him?
Because I am him.
Because you am him.
[looks back confusedly]

[suspended in mid-air in Santa's sleigh which has run out of power]
Nobody moves, nobody dies.
[one of the elves sneezes and the sleigh drops]
Santa's in the slammer! We gotta get him out! Is vagrancy a capital crime?
I don't think I quite have the magic for another season.
I think that every time they send me to Cleveland.
